channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Elon Musk Trolls Britain and Defends Tommy Robinson in Flurry of Social Media Posts
item.description: In a barrage of posts rife with misinformation, he revived questions about a child sex abuse scandal, vilified the prime minister and defended a jaile...

item.title: European Ministers Visit Syria to Strengthen Ties With New Government
item.description: Top diplomats from Germany and France went to Damascus on behalf of the European Union. It’s the first such trip in years, part of a flurry of Western...

item.title: Iconic Brompton bike maker suffers 99% profit decline amid post-COVID bike industry turmoil
item.description: Profits fell to just £4,600 last year as the foldable bike brand fought copycat competitors and falling demand.

item.title: Dinosaur Footprints Found in England by Quarry Workers
item.description: The prints were made by both long-necked sauropods and a predator, megalosaurus, and were found in one of the largest discoveries in decades.

item.title: Europe stunned the world with its ‘regulatory tsunami’ last year—but AI and Trump will add new snags in 2025
item.description: The EU went after Big Tech in 2024. The new year will add more players to the regulatory tussle, including Donald Trump and Elon Musk.

item.title: South Korea Fails to Detain Impeached President in Standoff at His Home
item.description: Blocked by bodyguards, officials retreated after several hours without serving a court warrant to hold President Yoon Suk Yeol for questioning on insu...

item.title: TGI Fridays’ ex-CEO—who introduced sushi to a restaurant chain famous for potato skins and mozzarella sticks—will step up to oversee hundreds of locations post-bankruptcy
item.description: Ray Blanchette served as CEO from 2018 to 2023, a time when Fridays struggled during the pandemic.

item.title: Do You Believe in Life After Death? These Scientists Study It.
item.description: Is reincarnation real? Is communication from the “beyond” possible? A small set of academics are trying to find out, case by case.

item.title: Here’s what you need to know about Turo, the app allegedly used to rent cars before the New Orleans attack and the Cybertruck explosion near a Las Vegas Trump Hotel
item.description: The Turo app is like Airbnb for renting vehicles.

item.title: David Lodge, British Novelist Who Satirized Academic Life, Dies at 89
item.description: His 15 well-plotted novels teemed with romance and strange coincidence. An erudite literary critic with an ear for language, he also wrote a raft of n...

item.title: South Korea Fails to Arrest Impeached President
item.description: Corruption investigators seeking to arrest President Yoon Suk Yeol at his official residence in Seoul were in a standoff with the Presidential Securit...

item.title: Awaiting Sentencing, Menendez Pleads for Leniency and Blames His Wife
item.description: As they did during his trial, lawyers for the former senator argued in a court filing that he had been led astray by his wife, Nadine Menendez.

item.title: European Ministers Visit Syria to Strengthen Ties With New Government
item.description: Top diplomats from Germany and France went to Damascus on behalf of the European Union. It’s the first such trip in years, part of a flurry of Western...

item.title: Social stigma still overshadows 0.0 drinks for Gen Z, even as Diageo, Heineken, and AB InBev bet big on alcohol-free options
item.description: “Alcohol has played a central role in the way humans socialize," making it harder to cut the habit out, Oxford University's Charles Spence said.

item.title: Soldier’s Bomb in Cybertruck Explosion at Trump Hotel Could Have Been More Lethal
item.description: Fellow soldiers say the Army sergeant who set off the explosion could have done far more harm. Investigators are trying to figure out why he didn’t.
